p:
Sensitivity analysis identified k vec as the highest impact parameter, approximately three times more potent in changing model output than the following, α
η . Parameters directly controlling susceptibility and vector abundance, α scpH, α scpV, and α ovt, also have high sensitivities, which suggests that vector activity, biting rate, has a pivotal role in determining the rate and impact of disease spread (see S2 Fig). Due to their high sensitivities, and as a consequence of Bayesian inference, these parameters might bear the indirect effects of some of the factors which we have not accounted for, e.g. variability of vector and human activities during the day.
